name: places/ChIJESLYoxZawokRLaFZ16_-Elk
formattedAddress: 15 William St, New York, NY 10005, USA
adrFormatAddress: 15 William St, New York, NY 10005, USA

originalText.text:
On average I've spent around $300-$500 per month at this garage for the past year.  Yesterday, "Wilson" (short, older guy with a full beard who appears to be a mix of Italian and Mexican) decided to dismissively refuse to park my vehicle because there was 2 inches of snow on the hood.

I see Wilson nearly every time I park so I've come to know him and his behavior quite well.   He consistently has an attitude that demonstrates how deeply he resents his job.

This includes, but is not limited to:

1) Outright refusal to reply or dodgy avoidance when responding to customers who ask questions or push back about pricing that doesn't align with posted pricing signage and appears to change subjectively based on what Wilson feels like charging.

2) Parking and retrieving cars out of order based on who he appears to prefer, which has made other customers irate in my presence.

3)  Taking his time to serve customers who are waiting at the window while he appears to watch TV on his phone.

Based on the prior reviews here that go back years, it's clear that at least this location of Icon Parking doesn't hold/train their employees to a professional standard and instead allows behavior like Wilson's to persist undeterred, while they knowingly lose business hand-over-fist as they did yesterday when I went to another parking garage around the corner and parked without any problems or attitude about 2 inches of snow.

I genuinely wonder when Icon parking will put a new manager in place who will actually respond (beyond a corporate template response) to the reviews here, begin training/managing their staff and start turning the boat around on their 1.5 star rating.

originalText.text: I’d give negative star.  Will never use ICON again. Bought $72.50 online parking e-ticket, got 39 Exchange Pl based on their linked direction, and was yelled and pushed out of the place saying it’s only for monthly. Very rude to customers.  My first ever complain comment on any commercial stuff.

originalText.text:
Had to park here through the hotel I was staying in which was only 2 blocks away. When I got there the entryway was blocked by SUVs (the front one was a Chevy Suburban) so I parked on the street and walked down (where I saw several Land Rovers and other high end cars). There was a lady waiting for her vehicle when I got there which they were just pulling up with. She had a 4th Gen Land Rover Range Rover HSE. I told the attendant why I was there and he asked my what kind of vehicle I had. I told him a Nissan Pathfinder. He then told me it was too big that I would have to park at their 50 Gold st. location. I was confused but walked back to my car only to watch as the lady in the Range Rover drove right passed my Pathfinder and thought...those are the same size. Hmmm...I was too big?

Range Rover:
Length-196.8 in
Width-81.6 in (mirrors folded)
Height-72.2 in

Pathfinder:
Length-197.7 in
Width-77.9 in
Height-70.9 in

The other location was another 8 blocks away so my walk back to the hotel took over 15 minutes. When I got back to my room my wife noticed at the bottom of our ticket is said "damaged vehicle". Our Pathfinder is brand new and hit 5000 miles that day and had no damage. So I had to walk the 10 blocks back to ensure that was a mistake, the card they had inside had no noted damage and I was assured my ticket saying that was a mistake and wouldn't be an issue. 3 days, even with the hotel discount, cost $120.

originalText.text:
I should have checked reviews before I booked parking here.  My wife's family jist flew in from Brazil and we needed a place to park close to the WTC. I booked parking on the parkwhiz app and the manager did not want to honor it.  Upon arrival he threw us out and kept talking over me being very rude and unprofessional.  While I tried explaining I booked and paid he said he didn't care.  When asked how would I get a refund again he didn't care.  My family was worried and upset with how this man seemed very angry and out of control.  In the end he finally honored the reservation but wasn't happy about it.  Even upon arrival for pick up he was still obnoxious and rude. Honestly this was the first time I parked in the city that I felt my car and items were not safe. from the staff.
If this is how Icon keeps their facilities staffed I will not use another one.

originalText.text:
I have been parking in this garage for almost a year now.  It has not been crazy bad until today...I have reached my limit!  This will be the third time that I have had my spot switched on me in less than a year.  I pay $800/mo for one car and one motorcycle.  I usually ride my motorcycle in every day, but today my spot was given to someone else.  The other spots require that you sit and wait on them to move vehicles in order for you to park.  I wish I had the type of job that would allow for me to sit and wait, but that is not the case.  I need easy in and out access.  I spoke with the Garage Manager and he had the nerve to tell me that the new person parking pays more!!!  I said that I could not argue with him and that I would call his corporate office.

I also would like to affirm what others have said below...the rate is base on the care your driving and how you look.  If they think they can get m ore out of you they will!  I have heard and seen them quote people with the same size vehicles for the same amounts of time different prices.  Icon is usually a good parking provider, but this location is shady.

There are several other garages in the area with integrity and will treat everyone the same...trust me it is worth walking another block or so not to be scammed by this location.
